name: Léo BECHET
title: PhD student at Uppsala University
shortIntro: PhD student at Uppsala University, with a background in computational physics and artificial intelligence, I strive in creating custom solutions for any challenges.
longIntro:
Personal Introduction

Hello! I am Léo Bechet, a computational physicist and AI enthusiast with a strong passion for astronomy, optics, and computer science. Curious and analytical, I thrive on complex technical challenges and enjoy exploring interdisciplinary scientific problems. I am fluent in English (C1+) and French (native), with basic knowledge of Spanish and Japanese.

Professional Introduction

I hold a Master's degree in Computational Physics and am pursuing a PhD in energy-efficient algorithmic solutions. I specialize in computational physics, AI, and neural network development. My work blends scientific research with practical software development, including high-performance simulations, GPU programming, and hybrid neural network training methods.

Education

  • PhD – Energy-efficient algorithmic solutions driven by data-intensive applications, Uppsala University
  • Master 2 & Master 1 – Physics & Computational Physics, University of Bourgogne Franche-Comté
  • Bachelor – Fundamental Physics, University of Bourgogne Franche-Comté
  • Higher school preparatory classes – Physics-Chemistry & Engineering Science, Lycée Follereau

Research Experience

  • Hybrid Gradient Propagation via DFA-Seeding, System 7 Lab, Tokyo University
  • Stepper Motor-Based Laser Sweeping, FEMTO-ST
  • 3D Extinction Mapping of the Milky Way using ANN, University of Bourgogne Franche-Comté
  • Multidimensional Potential Energy Surfaces, University of Bourgogne Franche-Comté
  • Space Battle Around a Black Hole Simulation, University of Bourgogne Franche-Comté

Projects

  • GPU/CPU Optimized N-Body Simulation
  • Conway’s Game of Life Stability Study
  • Strange Attractor Visualizer
  • Marching Cubes Algorithm Web Demo
  • Web-Based 3D Raycast Renderer

Skills & Focus Areas

  • Programming: Fortran, OpenMP, OpenACC, Python, JavaScript/HTML/CSS, NodeJS, C#, C, Bash, GLSL/HLSL
  • Frameworks & Tools: TensorFlow, PyTorch, Jupyter, LaTeX, Docker, Fusion 360
  • Numerical & Physical Simulations, Embedded Systems, Server Administration

Interests

  • Astronomy & Astrophotography
  • Optics and Experimental Chemistry
  • Procedural Simulations & AI Research
  • Photography, Image Processing, and Computer Graphics

projects.name: FeatherPress
projects.shortDescription: A lightweight Node.js server designed to serve Markdown files as HTML web pages, featuring template injection, category indexes, syntax highlighting, LaTeX support, and flexible content organization.

projects.name: Cellular Automata
projects.shortDescription: A Python-based implementation of multiple Cellular Automata. The system supports CUDA kernels and implements hardware acceleration using GPU.

projects.name: Monte Carlon Rate-Equations
projects.shortDescription: A high-performance Python simulation of particle aggregation using Numba for parallel processing. Features a custom multi-pass grid update and analysis with DFS and parallel Union-Find.

name: Niels FAUCHER
shortIntro: Graduate in computational physics and specialized in artificial intelligence, my goal is to architect and implement sophisticated algorithms and predictive models to analyze large-scale datasets, providing data-centric solutions for complex systems or any challenges.
longIntro:
Personal Introduction

Hello! I am Niels FAUCHER, a computational physicist and AI enthusiast with a strong passion for non-linear systems and condensed matter physics, with a specific focus on the emergent behavior of magnetic skyrmions. As a computational physicist, I specialize in predictive modeling using Reservoir Computing (RC). My work is focused on applying these models to highly complex non-linear systems, pushing the boundaries of their predictive capabilities while continuously advancing their architecture. I am fluent in English (C1+) and French (native), with basic knowledge of Italian.

Professional Introduction

I hold a Master's degree in Computational Physics and am applying this expertise at Adularia, a company dedicated to developing next-generation immunotherapies. My role is to pioneer an AI strategy using generative models, architecting systems with techniques like Flow Matching that excel at constructing complex, structured data from simple noise.
Alongside this focus on generative AI, I have a distinct specialization in an alternative computational paradigm: Reservoir Computing. This expertise is not just theoretical; it was the core of my research internship at the University of Tokyo, where I was tasked with designing and building a numerical Physical Reservoir Computer (PRC) from the ground up, using the dynamics of magnetic skyrmions.

Education

  • Master 2 & Master 1 – Physics & Computational Physics, University of Bourgogne Franche-Comté
  • Bachelor – Fundamental Physics, University of Montpellier

Research Experience

  • Physical Reservoir Computing based on magnetic skyrmion, Physical Intelligence Lab, Tokyo University
  • Study of the Kuramoto model for Photonic AI, FEMTO-ST
  • Developement of a Monte Carlo Markov Chain (MCMC) to study the internal structure of planets, University of Zurich
  • Developement of the world investement network (WIN) based on the Pagerank algorithm, University of Bourgogne Franche-Comté
  • PhotoElectric Heating On Interstellar Grains Simulation, University of Bourgogne Franche-Comté

Projects

  • GPU/CPU Optimized N-Body Simulation
  • Non-linear model simulation: Study of the Tamari model
  • Application of principal component analysis(PCA) to the analysis of sports results
  • Study the behavior of two types of Carbon NanoTubes using the software VASP (Vienna Ab initio Simulation Package)

Skills & Focus Areas

  • Programming: Fortran, OpenMP, OpenACC, Python, Bash
  • Frameworks & Tools: Magnum.np, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Jupyter, LaTeX
  • Numerical & Physical Simulations

Interests

  • Exploring complex system and utilized them for next-generation computing and predictive intelligence.
  • Procedural Simulations & AI Research
  • Sports : swimming, hiking and wrestling

name: Hugo ALEXANDRE
title: PhD Student in Gravitational Waves Astronomy at LPC-Caen
shortIntro: I hold a Master’s in Theoretical Physics, a Master’s in Computational Physics, and a Magistère in Mathematics for Physics. Currently pursuing a PhD on fast detection algorithms for supermassive black hole mergers in the LISA mission.
longIntro:
Personal Introduction

Hello! I am Hugo Alexandre, a French astrophysicist specializing in gravitational waves. Passionate about science and coding, I enjoy tackling challenging problems, sharing knowledge, and applying my expertise to help others navigate complex scientific domains. I am a native French speaker with a C1 level in English.

Professional Introduction

I am a gravitational-wave physicist with a strong background in theoretical physics, including quantum field theory and general relativity. Alongside this foundation, I have developed solid computational skills through my Master's studies and research projects, ranging from coding on clusters and code parallelization to data analysis with AI and machine learning. My current work focuses on advanced data-analysis methods, such as normalizing flows applied to simulated galaxy catalogs, bridging fundamental theory with modern computational approaches.

Education

  • 2025 – Present: PhD Thesis in Gravitational-Wave Astrophysics, Université de Caen Normandie (UniCaen) and LPC. Research on coronagraphic methods for rapid localization of supermassive black holes for the LISA mission.
  • 2024 – 2025: International Master’s Degree in Computational Physics, Université Marie-Louis Pasteur (UMLP). Specialization in Machine Learning and Numerical Simulations.
  • 2021 – 2023: Master’s Degree in Subatomic Physics & Cosmology, Université Grenoble Alpes (UGA). Specialization in Cosmology, Astroparticles, and Gravitational Waves.
  • 2021 – 2023: Magister’s Degree in Fundamental Physics, Université Grenoble Alpes (UGA). Specialization in Research and Mathematics of General Relativity.
  • 2018 – 2021: Bachelor’s Degree in Physics, Université Grenoble Alpes (UGA).
  • 2018 – 2019: Research Passport University Diploma, Université Grenoble Alpes (UGA).

Research Experience

  • 06/2025: Participant at the 4th MaNiTou Summer School on Gravitational Waves (Marseille, Luminy Campus). Intensive training in GW theory, instrumentation, data analysis, and astrophysical applications.
  • 02/2025 – Present: M2 Internship at OCA/ARTEMIS (Nice). Development of machine learning methods to model the galaxy using compact binaries observed by LISA.
  • 09/2024: Visit to Virgo Gravitational Wave Interferometer. Engaged in technical discussions on detector design and performance during a documentary filming.
  • 02/2023 – 07/2023: M2 Internship at LAPP (Annecy). Studied the influence of cosmology on the stochastic gravitational-wave background from compact binaries.
  • 06/2022 – 08/2022: M1 Internship at APC Laboratory (Paris). Analysis of the cosmic-ray Boron-over-Carbon ratio from Voyager 1 observations.
  • 02/2022: Participant, 9th French Physicists’ Tournament (ENSTA, Paris). Presented a physics problem in English during a competitive scientific event.
  • 01/2022 – Present: Founder of 1minute2physique (TikTok). Creator of short educational videos with simulations, mathematical insights, and popular physics content.

Projects

  • Black-Hole-Shadow: Simulation demonstrating that the black hole shadow extends beyond the event horizon.
  • Solar-System: 2D simulation of planetary motion highlighting Mercury’s precession in Newtonian gravity.
  • Gravitational-Waveform-and-Orbit: Simulation of gravitational waves and orbital dynamics from compact binary coalescence.
  • Quantum-Tunneling-Effect-Double-Slit-Exp: Numerical study of tunneling and double-slit interference in quantum mechanics.
  • Black-Hole-Simulation: Visualization of gravitational lensing by a black hole.
  • Atomic-Orbital: Simulations of hydrogen atomic orbitals in 2D and 3D.

Skills & Focus Areas

  • Python: Machine Learning (PyTorch, Normalizing Flows), Data Analysis (Bayesian Inference, MCMC), Simulations (FDTD, Matplotlib), Cluster Computing (CCIN2P3).
  • LaTeX: Scientific writing, reports, CVs, posters, and typesetting of complex equations.
  • Fortran: Basic programming and numerical problem solving.
  • Additional: Teaching, writing skills, theoretical and numerical expertise.

Interests

Astronomy & Astrophysics, Quantum Mechanics & Quantum Field Theory, Mathematics, Martial Arts, Teaching, and Visual Simulations.
